Here's some tips to get you off to a good start:

- Join me on the [Zulip developers' server](https://chat.zulip.org), to get help, chat about this issue, and meet the other developers.
- [Unwatch this repository](https://help.github.com/articles/unwatching-repositories/), so that you don't get 100 emails a day.

As you work on this issue, you'll also want to refer to the [Zulip code contribution guide](https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/index.html), as well as the rest of the developer documentation on that site.

See you on the other side (that is, the pull request side)!

issue.title: css: Show non-sticky recipient bar action buttons on hover.

labels.name: area: message feed UI
labels.description: Buttons/UI directly in the message feed (not popovers, etc.)

labels.name: redesign
labels.description: Part of the webapp redesign project, including blockers.

labels.name: maintainer review
labels.description: PR is ready for review by Zulip maintainers.

issue.body:
Fixes: #26852 [CZO thread (The design idea discussion)](https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/UI.20redesign.3A.20recipient.20bar/near/1598308) [CZO thread (Implementation approach discussion)](https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/6-frontend/topic/Show.20action.20buttons.20on.20hover.20.28recipient.20bars.29) - Recipient bars show the action buttons on hover, except for the sticky recipient bar which always shows the action buttons. - The CSS rule `visibility: hidden;` is toggled on hover, and `visibility: visible;` applied if the bar is sticky. - The disappearance of the action buttons when action UI (notification menu, topic editing UI) is shown is prevented by using `:focus-within` CSS pseudo class on the recipient_bar to add `visibility: visible` to the action buttons. - In case of conversation views, since there is a single message box present, the controls are made forever visible by using the CSS `:only-child` pseudo selector. **Screenshots and screen captures:** ### Final Look ![zulip-268](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/11803841/269af734-bcca-49d5-831f-9bc993f32c9b)
Action UI remains intact
Previously (All controls visible)
Conversation view
---

Individual commits are ready for review (see [commit discipline](https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/commit-discipline.html)). - [x] Each commit is a coherent idea. - [x] Commit message(s) explain reasoning and motivation for changes. comment.body: I was sure I saw some slowdown in rendering the messages when user card popover was open from right sidebar when I was testing this. I assumed it was the `find` query but since I cannot reproduce it any longer, we should probably test deploy it to really ensure it.

pull_request.title: Don't hide popovers on scrolling / resize.
pull_request.body:
There are few things to notice:
* It doesn't work perfectly for resize as the `reference` can hide during the reisze which triggers the popover to hide, but I don't think that's a real issue since for mobile overlay popovers, it works to not hide the popovers with `show-when-reference-hidden` class.
* If the reference goes under fixed / sticky element, but not outside the window, the popover would still be visible but the reference not. It is super expensive to do that check so, instead we just check compose, navbar or sticky message header not obscuring the reference which is where it makes a real difference.

issue.title: Document deleting multiple drafts via checkboxes
issue.body:
We should document the feature introduced in #19360 / PR #25610 on https://zulip.com/help/view-and-edit-your-message-drafts.

Probably this will be mean replacing the "Delete a draft"  heading with "Delete drafts", and potentially using multiple tabs to explain the UI.

issue.title: Document option to paste URL to create a named link
issue.body:
We should document the new functionality in #18692.

I would add a "Via paste" tab to https://zulip.com/help/insert-a-link#insert-a-link_1, probably as the first tab, since that's often the most handy option.

issue.title: Do not display two warning banners for two mentions of the same private stream

labels.name: area: compose (banners & validation)
labels.description: Validation and banners in the compose box

issue.body:
<!-- Issue description -->

As reported on CZO, we show two warnings for mentioning the same private stream twice. We should fix this.

![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/2090066/9269fbd1-3461-4e6c-901b-192c70214e42)

It may be OK to fix this by displaying at most one such alert at a time, even if the alerts are for two different streams.

<!-- Link to a message in the chat.zulip.org discussion. Message links will still work even if the topic is renamed or resolved. Link back to this issue from the chat.zulip.org thread. -->

[CZO thread](https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/9-issues/topic/double.20warning.20banner/near/1589964)

comment.body:
> Hello, @Esther146 I have already opened a PR regarding this issue and it is still a WIP.
Hello @singhutsav5502, my bad! I thought it wasn’t assigned to anyone since last week because I didn’t see ```in progress``` label on it and you didn’t claim it back as suggested by zulipbot. I also made a PR before seeing your comment.
Used `$tippy_box.is("[data-reference-hidden]")` since `$tippy_box[0].attr("data-reference-hidden") === ""` can be weird for a truth check.

* If the reference goes under fixed / sticky element, but not outside the window, the popover would still be visible but the reference not. It is super expensive to do that check so, instead we just check compose, navbar or sticky message header not obscuring the reference which is where it makes a real difference.

issue.title: keyboard UI: View read receipts using SHIFT + V
issue.body:
<!-- Describe your pull request here.-->
In the keydown_shift_mappings object, I added a value with read_receipts, message_view_only was also given the value of true.
To enable the view read receipt modal to be displayed in the UI when keys SHIFT + V is pressed, I used a switch statement such that when the named key is pressed on the key keyboard, the popover for the show_user_list displays.

pull_request.title: input_pill: Fix backspace behavior on selecting text from start.
pull_request.body:
This commit fixes the behavior of trying to remove the selected text when selection is made from start in stream membership input and compose box dm using backspace button.

Previously the selected text was not removed if no typeahead was shown for the text and it instead removed the last pill.

Now we remove the selected text and not any input pills on pressing the backspace button irrespective whether tyepeahead is shown or not.

This commit updated the code to remove pill only when there is no other text or when the pointer is at start of input but its selection
 length is 0, in the input and let it follow the default behavior in
cases when there is any text (other than user pills) in the input to fix the bug.

<!-- Describe your pull request here.-->

Fixes: [#27403](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/27403) Irregular behaviour of input pill of the compose box (DM) and Stream Membership Input

<!-- If the PR makes UI changes, always include one or more still screenshots to demonstrate your changes. If it seems helpful, add a screen capture of the new functionality as well.

Tooling tips: https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorials/screenshot-and-gif-software.html
-->

The fix of adding ```selection?.toString()?.length === 0``` fixes the issue because:
- It prevents the default behaviour only when you're either trying to remove last pill with empty input field, or
- you're trying to remove last pill with some input present and backspace pressed at anchorOffset=0 but size of the selection is 0

**Screenshots and screen captures:**
![jy5c9VdwGK](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/97049524/a06086ae-c801-40da-800c-f2a4d0228f8d)

<details>
<summary>Self-review checklist</summary>

https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/code-reviewing.html#how-to-review-code -->

issue.title: Irregular behaviour of input pill of the compose box (DM) and Stream Membership Input
issue.body:
The following issue is observed in both the **Stream membership Input** and the **Compose Box**, since they share the same [component](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/0a33598f6558fc6f9446cb67f61386d3cb0a481c/web/src/input_pill.ts#L4).
- Selections of input being initiated from ```anchorOffset===0```+ backspace doesn't work but if selection made from any point except starting point, and ```backspace pressed```, it works fine.
- After one or more pills are added, and then the ` selection from ```anchorOffset===0```+ backspace is done for remaining text, it removes the Last Pill rather than the text.
![brave_F9ICg7mvwg](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/97049524/b8161183-23b4-4db5-999d-a0f3e53d50b3) - If the input being entered has a TYPEAHEAD, then everything works as good:
![brave_jietLp1DN7](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/97049524/56c8c87d-2226-43f3-a9bf-821fb59fffc8) Steps to Reproduce the issue: - Go to ```Settings``` -> ```Manage Streams``` - Click on a stream name. - Go to the Subscribers tab. - In Stream membership input, type some text - replicate as described in issue. or - Go to Compose Box, and choose the DM field. - In the input field for tagging person to DM with, replicate as suggested in issue. **Things to be taken care of while fixing the issue**: Can not remove the ```selection?.anchorOffset === 0``` condition since it is essential for removing the Last Pill when backspace is pressed at ```anchorOffset===0``` by preventing default behaviour of backspace.

issue.title: Issue #26914 remove warning banner duplication
issue.body:
compose_banners: Add `visible_banners` set to prevent duplicate warning banners.
2 utility functions added for better readability,  `append_visible_banners` to append strings into visible_banners and `in_visible_banners` to check if a particular data string already exists in the set.

Introduces a "visible_banners" set in compose_banners to store strings containing details of currently rendered banners. This set is cleared in instances where `compose_actions.cancel()` is triggered, ensuring smooth functionality with hotkeys and the close button. The implementation checks for existing banners to prevent duplicate warning banners from being displayed when mentioning private streams. Duplicate warning banners are not created for the same stream while warnings for other streams still get rendered.


Fixes: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/26914



![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/29460617/5f2d68a9-8b4b-4283-9e1d-ed31be680d73)

<details>
<summary>Self-review checklist</summary>

<!-- Prior to submitting a PR, follow our step-by-step guide to review your own code:
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/code-reviewing.html#how-to-review-code -->

<!-- Once you create the PR, check off all the steps below that you have completed.
If any of these steps are not relevant or you have not completed, leave them unchecked.-->

      (variable names, code reuse, readability, etc.).

Communicate decisions, questions, and potential concerns.

- [ ] Explains differences from previous plans (e.g., issue description).
- [x] Highlights technical choices and bugs encountered.
- [ ] Calls out remaining decisions and concerns.
- [ ] Automated tests verify logic where appropriate.

Individual commits are ready for review (see [commit discipline](https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/commit-discipline.html)).

- [x] Each commit is a coherent idea.
- [x] Commit message(s) explain reasoning and motivation for changes.

Completed manual review and testing of the following:

- [x] Visual appearance of the changes.
- [ ] Responsiveness and internationalization.
- [ ] Strings and tooltips.
- [x] End-to-end functionality of buttons, interactions and flows.
- [x] Corner cases, error conditions, and easily imagined bugs.
</details>

comment.body: gentle bump @alya @karlstolley , please review when possible, also there seems to be an issue regarding the claiming of the issue that this PR fixes, please look into it as well.

issue.title: help: Document "Start new conversation" button.
issue.body:
- Documents the new contextually-aware button since the instructions now differ depending on whether you're currently in a direct message view or not.
- Simplifies the new topic instructions by combining the first two tabs into a single web/desktop tab, with an optional step 2 to change the destination stream.

Fixes #27159.

**Screenshots and screen captures:**
- http://zulip.com/help/starting-a-new-topic
![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/2343554/a5c63cde-c7a7-4e62-b813-2e91f80b1879)

- http://zulip.com//help/starting-a-new-direct-message
- http://zulip.com/help/direct-messages
![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/2343554/55e73219-f168-4e39-a190-45fcad2cea3d)

- http://zulip.com/help/open-the-compose-box
![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/2343554/bf6b4355-6847-4fad-9022-efe982d879b4)

- http://zulip.com/help/mastering-the-compose-box
![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/2343554/6ed049a2-2475-4ca1-826c-43178a750daf)

comment.body: Hm, OK, but that section is all about changing where you're composing to. I really think we should bring that instruction back where it was.

issue.title: Do not display two warning banners for two mentions of the same private stream

labels.name: area: compose (banners & validation)
labels.description: Validation and banners in the compose box

issue.body:
<!-- Issue description -->

As reported on CZO, we show two warnings for mentioning the same private stream twice. We should fix this.

![image](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/2090066/9269fbd1-3461-4e6c-901b-192c70214e42)

It may be OK to fix this by displaying at most one such alert at a time, even if the alerts are for two different streams.

<!-- Link to a message in the chat.zulip.org discussion. Message links will still work even if the topic is renamed or resolved. Link back to this issue from the chat.zulip.org thread. -->

[CZO thread](https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/9-issues/topic/double.20warning.20banner/near/1589964)

comment.body: Hi @singhutsav5502, I claimed it because it wasn’t assigned to anyone and in progress was removed since last week. I'm even done with the changes.

issue.title: Fix order of group direct message recipients.

labels.name: area: message feed display
labels.description: Web frontend rendering of messages (post markdown)

issue.body:
The order of names of group DM recipients is not consistent at all places and we should make it consistent.

Current behavior -
- In the message header bar and DMs list in left sidebar are sorted by names while considering name as simple strings, i.e. uppercase letters are given preference. For example - a group DM with aaron, polonius, zoe, the names are shown as **"Polonius, Zoe and aaron"** in the above mentioned places.

- In the search bar title, compose box placeholder and recipient pill input in compose box, the users are sorted by `email` field in user objects. For example - a group DM with aaron, polonius and zoe, the names are shown as **"Polonius, aaron and Zoe"** as the `email` field for polonius, aaron and zoe are "user13@zulipdev.com", "user6@zulipdev.com" and "user7@zulipdev.com" as the email-address-visibility is set to "admins only" by default.


Expected behavior -

The order of names should be consistent at all places and should be like we have it in the right sidebar, i.e. the names are sorted considering all letters are lowercase. So, the order of names for the users mentioned in above example would be - **"aaron, Polonius, Zoe"**.

We should check the ordering of names in other places as well which are not mentioned above like tooltips, etc and correct them if needed.

Discussion - https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/Sorting.20order.20of.20group.20DM.20recipients

Sharing a screenshot below to demonstrate the above mentioned examples -

![Screenshot from 2023-10-25 22-07-45](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/35494118/6a30cd8b-e884-4e2b-8df6-b425026fbf19)

comment.body:
Welcome to Zulip, @Jenil-Dobariya! We just sent you an invite to collaborate on this repository at https://github.com/zulip/zulip/invitations. Please accept this invite in order to claim this issue and begin a fun, rewarding experience contributing to Zulip!

Here's some tips to get you off to a good start:

- Join me on the [Zulip developers' server](https://chat.zulip.org), to get help, chat about this issue, and meet the other developers.
- [Unwatch this repository](https://help.github.com/articles/unwatching-repositories/), so that you don't get 100 emails a day.

As you work on this issue, you'll also want to refer to the [Zulip code contribution guide](https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/index.html), as well as the rest of the developer documentation on that site.

See you on the other side (that is, the pull request side)!

The order of names of group DM recipients is not consistent at all places and we should make it consistent.

For example - a group DM with aaron, polonius, zoe, the names are shown as **"Polonius, Zoe and aaron"** in the above mentioned places.

- In the search bar title, compose box placeholder and recipient pill input in compose box, the users are sorted by `email` field in user objects. For example - a group DM with aaron, polonius and zoe, the names are shown as **"Polonius, aaron and Zoe"** as the `email` field for polonius, aaron and zoe are "user13@zulipdev.com", "user6@zulipdev.com" and "user7@zulipdev.com" as the email-address-visibility is set to "admins only" by default.


Expected behavior -

The order of names should be consistent at all places and should be like we have it in the right sidebar, i.e. the names are sorted considering all letters are lowercase. So, the order of names for the users mentioned in above example would be - **"aaron, Polonius, Zoe"**.

We should check the ordering of names in other places as well which are not mentioned above like tooltips, etc and correct them if needed.

Discussion - https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/Sorting.20order.20of.20group.20DM.20recipients

issue.title: Extraneous compose button tooltips in logged out view
issue.body: Repro: 1. Open the app in the logged out view. 2. Click any of the compose buttons. 3. Click `x` to exit the login modal. A tooltip unexpectedly shows up on the compose button.

comment.body:
Hi @alya , I was trying to figure out about the bug and i found another similar type of bug.
**Bug description**
1. Repeat the 3 steps described in above message.
2. Press any shortcut key of compose buttons on keyboard ( e.g., x for new direct message )
3. close the login modal
4. Hover on any other element of the page

This is also showing unexpected tooltip on the compose button. 
I also attached a short video describing it:
[Screencast from 27-10-23 09:32:14 AM IST.webm](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/assets/118374765/7c434977-dcb4-4b82-924c-5063632993c9)
